admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
trustfund:
TF039389-MIDDLE EAST AND PACIFIC -
            SEWERAGE (IRAN, YEMAN, LEBANON)

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the environmental assessment for
            the Tehran Sewerage Project, which builds a piped sewerage
            system, sewage and sludge treatment facilities, and a
            sewerage drainage system. Measures to minimize negative
            environmental impacts include the following: During
            construction and operation, reduce noise levels by suitable
            dampening; screening plant air compressors and de-watering
            pumps with sandbags; restrict work to daytime where
            possible; issue workers equipment to protect hearing; and
            restrict construction traffic during nighttime. Mitigate
            vibration impacts by limiting the use of percussive
            equipment when excavating sewer trenches and tunnel shafts;
            and using dead-weight rather than vibration compaction
            plant. Dust problems will be alleviated by spraying water,
            covering stockpiles of excavated material with tarpaulins;
            providing workers with masks to keep from inhaling dust.
            Noisome odors will be controlled by covering containers and
            equipment, and designating the area surrounding the site as
            a greenbelt. Disposal of solid waste in the municipal
            landfill has been designed to prevent groundwater or surface
            runoff from contaminating the site. To ensure the health and
            safety of workers and the public, access to sewage treatment
            plant effluent will be restricted by installing a fence; a
            regular eradication program will use biodegradable
            pesticides for pest control; and other safety measures, such
            as barriers, flags, and bollards, will be used.
